trial_identification.studytitle: Conformite Europeenne (CE) Mark Study to Demonstrate the Safety and Performance of the Champion Vascular Closure System (VCS)
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Femoral Artery closure using the Cardiva Vascular Closure System (VCS) to reduce time to hemostasis and reduce time to ambulation

conditions.healthcondition: closure of femoral artery puncture wound

interventions.interventions: The Cardiva Champion VCS consists of a sterile disposable catheter containing a deployable extravascular collagen patch and a clip. The Champion VCS is intended to seal a femoral arterial access site at the end of any procedure that uses a 6French or 7 French cathether to access the femoral artery. This is a one time use device. The procedure of deploying the collagen patch takes less than 3-5 minutes.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The primary efficacy endpoint is the time to achieve arterial hemostasis.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Index procedure and 30 day Follow-up post procedure

primaryOutcome.outcome: The primary safety endpoint is the rate of major complications and the secondary safety endpoint is the rate of minor complications.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Index procedure and 30 day Follow-up post procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary efficacy endpoint is time to ambulation
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Ability of the subject to walk 20 feet without evidence of arterial re-bleeding from the access site. The time to ambulation will be measured in hours from the time the Champion catheter is removed until the subject is able to ambulate.
The time to discharge is measured from the time the Champion catheter is removed to hospital discharge.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The time to eligibility for hospital discharge
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: The time to eligibility for hospital discharge is measured from the time the Champion catheter is removed to the time, in the judgment of the investigator, that the subject was eligible for hospital discharge based on institution?s standard of care.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Clinically indicated for an diagnostic or interventional endovascular procedure anticipated to employ common femoral artery access using a modified Seldinger technique and a 6F or 7F introducer sheath
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Key PRE-OPERATIVE EXCLUSION CRITERIA 1.Septicemia or a cutaneous/subcutaneous groin infection 2.Ipsilateral femoral arteriotomy within the previous 30 days 3.Planned arterial access at the same site within the next 90 days 4.Extreme morbid obesity (Body mass index (BMI) greater than 45 kg/m2) or underweight (BMI less than 22 kg/m2) 5.Femoral artery diameter less than 6 mm 6.Difficulty achieving arterial access and/or inserting the introducer sheath at the onset of the procedure (e.g., multiple stick attempts) 7.Fluoroscopically visible calcium, atherosclerotic disease, or stent within 1 cm of the puncture site

trial_design.designfeatures: This is an open-label, prospective, multi-center clinical trial to evaluate the safety and performance of the Cardiva Vascular Closure System.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The Cardiva VCS consists of a sterile disposable catheter containing a deployable extravascular collagen patch and a clip. The Cardiva VCS is intended to seal or close the femoral arterial access sites while reducing time to hemostasis (stop the bleeding process) and time to ambulation (when a person can walk) in subjects who have undergone diagnostic or interventional endovascular procedures.
